intro: Thalictrum gracile, commonly known as slender meadow rue, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Thalictrum gracile is part of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy flowering plants. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland and woodland ecosystems.
